channel.title: [help] Sharpening twin hooks.[help]
channel.description:
Hey this is buddy i know how to sharpen so dont call me a noob cause i have shapened swords i just can sharpen my twin hooks. Well i have sharpened but then they end up looking like crap... Anyone got any ideas or show me how t sharpen this shape?? i have teamviewer and can post my mqo file on uppit...
[IMG]http://i697.photobucket.com/albums/vv332/Buddy_budster/twinhooks.png[/img]
any help would be apprieciated...
Thanks, Buddy

item.title: [help] Sharpening twin hooks.[help]
item.dc:creator: @Buddy_budster Buddy_budster
item.description:
@Buddy_budster wrote:

sanga282:

they look pretty cool as is, look like meat hooks

lol thanks take a look at google and type in deadliest warrior twin hooks and the tv show will pop up and take a look at how much damage they can do…

Read full topic

@dylan_0789 wrote:

Buddy_budster:

ok well i tried doing that dylan but it still didnt work it juts end up looking really messy… so i dont know what to do…

Then ask someone else. Idk about trace modelling so I can’t give much advice, sorry

item.title: [help] Sharpening twin hooks.[help]
item.dc:creator: @ak226688 ak226688
item.description:
@ak226688 wrote:

[quote=“dylan_0789, post:4, topic:280722”][quote author=owned654321241 link=topic=370777.msg2801931#msg2801931 date=1243485358]
This is more time consuming but you could go to side view and make a line of points were you want the “sharp edge” to go.
Then go to3D view and move the points then make faces from your model to the new line.
Make sense?
[/quote]
That ways faulty though. Your edge will be slightly crooked. This is another reason I’m tryin to promote primitive modelling[/quote]how u primitive model?

Read full topic

item.title: [help] Sharpening twin hooks.[help]
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

[quote=“owned654321241, post:3, topic:280722”]This is more time consuming but you could go to side view and make a line of points were you want the “sharp edge” to go.
Then go to3D view and move the points then make faces from your model to the new line.
Make sense?[/quote]
That ways faulty though. Your edge will be slightly crooked. This is another reason I’m tryin to promote primitive modelling

Read full topic

item.title: [help] Sharpening twin hooks.[help]
item.dc:creator: @owned654321241 owned654321241
item.description:
@owned654321241 wrote:

This is more time consuming but you could go to side view and make a line of points were you want the “sharp edge” to go.
Then go to3D view and move the points then make faces from your model to the new line.
Make sense?

Read full topic

item.title: [help] Sharpening twin hooks.[help]
item.dc:creator: @dylan_0789 dylan_0789
item.description:
@dylan_0789 wrote:

Loop cut(or knife) and join verticies. Or just join verts.
Another option is to extrude the edges where u want make a sharp edge. And join verticies.
If this doesn’t work tell me

Read full topic
